channel.title: How-To Geek
channel.description: We explain technology. Learn more with our articles, reviews, tips, and the best answers to your most pressing tech questions.

item.title: Region Codes: The Hidden Trap in Your DVD and Blu-ray Collection
item.dc:creator: Sydney Butler
item.description: If we could only all just get along.
item.content:encoded: Just as it seemed like physical media like DVDs and Blu-rays were about to disappear, the failures of the streaming industry has led to the rediscovery of media ownership. The thing is, if you didn't come up with DVDs and Blu-ray discs, you might not be aware of the restrictions that come with them.

item.title: The Outlook Lite App Is Shutting Down
item.dc:creator: Jorge A. Aguilar
item.description: It's time to switch over to the full version.
item.content:encoded: Microsoft is shutting down its Outlook Lite app for Android, a lightweight version of its email client that was designed for low-end phones and slower networks. The app will be retired starting on October 6, 2025, and after that date, new installations will be blocked.

item.title: 6 Things to Buy Instead of an iPhone 17, 17 Pro, or Air
item.dc:creator: Tim Brookes
item.description: You can still get an upgrade while spending far less.
item.content:encoded: The iPhone 17, fancier Pro version, and an all-new slim model are just slightly better iterations of the iPhone you already have in your pocket. While everyone loves an upgrade, not everyone needs an upgrade.

item.title: Graham Greene's Top 10 Iconic Film Roles: A Tribute to a Legend
item.dc:creator: Mark McPherson
item.description: From Kicking Bird in Dances With Wolves to Edgar Montrose in The Red Green Show, explore the late Graham Greene's most memorable performances.
item.content:encoded: Graham Greene was the Canadian actor I have always enjoyed appearing in film and television. Whether you knew him best as Edgar Montrose from The Red Green Show or Kicking Bird from Dances With Wolves, he had a charming presence whenever he graced screens big or small. He was always working, meaning there was a high chance you’d see him in a TV show like Defiance or a film like Casino Jack.

item.title: How to Restructure Data in Microsoft Excel
item.dc:creator: Tony Phillips
item.content:encoded: Manually reshaping data in Microsoft Excel can take time and will likely lead to errors. Fortunately, the program offers many tools and functions to transform your data in seconds. Here are seven data-shaping tricks you must know.

item.title: How I Created the Ultimate Rescue Drive for My PCs
item.dc:creator: Ali Haider
item.description: A pocket-sized lifeline for your computer.
item.content:encoded: Imagine this: you come home, turn on your PC or laptop, and it won’t boot. Now what? You had important work to do. Panic sets in, and you don’t know what to do next.

item.title: 2025 VW ID.4 vs. Ioniq 5 vs. Kia EV6: Which Electric SUV Is the Best Deal?
item.dc:creator: Adam Gray
item.description: These three electric SUVs compete closely, but one offers the best deal for 2025 buyers.
item.content:encoded: The Tesla Model Y may still be the best-selling electric crossover in 2025, but cracks are starting to show. Sales have slipped hard over the past few months, and plenty of shoppers are eyeing other options.

item.title: The Best Non-MCU Marvel Movies You Can Stream Right Now
item.dc:creator: Chris Snellgrove
item.description: The top non-MCU Marvel films that pack a punch, from iconic Spider-Man to gritty Blade. Stream these action-packed classics now!
item.content:encoded: While the brand has lost some of its luster in recent years, the average person still associates Marvel movies with the MCU, the cinematic universe that brought us everything from Iron Man to The Thunderbolts. But the MCU wasn’t born until 2008, and there were plenty of Marvel films created before that. And even after that, there have been more films made outside of the MCU umbrella than you can shake an Infinity Gauntlet at.

item.title: I Went Back and Booted the First Linux Distro I Ever Tried
item.dc:creator: David Delony
item.description: You never forget your first distro.
item.content:encoded: Nearly every Linux user seems to remember their first encounter with the OS. I decided to try booting up the first distro I ever tried, Knoppix, to see how well it held up since I first tried it over 20 years ago.

item.title: The iPhone Plus Is Dead, Here's What You Should Buy Instead
item.dc:creator: Tim Brookes
item.description: The Plus isn't really gone, it's just changed a bit.
item.content:encoded: Lost among the fanfare about the iPhone Air and the iPhone 17 Pro’s chunky camera block is news of a fallen comrade: the Plus-sized base model iPhone. This is bad news for anyone who preferred a larger screen, but there are still some options available.
